intro: Grastidium obscure-auriculatum, commonly known as the obscure-auriculate grastidium, is a rare and lesser-known species of flowering plant. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in umbels, a common floral arrangement in the family. It is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands or stream banks. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
